intro: Bunium crassifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved fennel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its robust, upright stems and broad, pinnately lobed leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family, and it produces oval, ribbed fruits. Bunium crassifolium is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its medicinal and culinary uses.
